content:
Diagnosis:

Inflammatory breast cancer with liver and bone metastases

Staging March 2024: T4dN2M1, Grade 3 inflammatory carcinoma, ER/PR negative, HER2 positive, PIK3CA mutation detected

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension
Depression

Current medications:
Trastuzumab/Pertuzumab/Docetaxel combination
Alpelisib commenced 15/3/24
Metformin
Ramipril
Sertraline

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Progressive disease on cycle 4 of current treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her daughter. Unfortunately, she has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. Her inflammatory changes affecting the right breast have worsened with increased erythema and skin nodularity. She describes worsening right upper quadrant discomfort which I suspect reflects progression of her liver metastases. Her mobility has declined significantly due to increasing bone pain, particularly affecting her lumbar spine and left hip. She now requires assistance with most daily activities and is spending approximately 60% of the day resting.

Her latest CT scan from 12/4/24 shows progressive disease with a 30% increase in liver metastases and new bone lesions in T11 and right acetabulum. The inflammatory changes in the right breast have also progressed clinically. Her tumor markers show a corresponding rise with CA15-3 increasing from 120 to 345.

We had a detailed discussion about modifying her treatment approach. Given her HER2 positive disease, I have recommended switching to Trastuzumab-deruxtecan (T-DXd). I have explained the rationale, potential benefits and side effects in detail. We will arrange urgent radiotherapy to her symptomatic bone metastases before commencing the new treatment. I have also referred her to our palliative care team for additional support with symptom management.

The plan is to proceed with urgent radiotherapy planning next week, aiming to treat her lumbar spine and left hip. We will then commence T-DXd, with the first cycle planned for 2/5/24. I have organized weekly review initially given her declining status. I have also arranged urgent bone strengthening with Zoledronic acid which will be given tomorrow.
